content: Alerts are temporary notifications for feedback. They can contain a `title`, `description`, and an `icon`. Key features include different colors and variants.

Alerts come with 6 color variants (`default`, `primary`, `secondary`, `success`, `warning`, `danger`), 4 style `variants` (solid, bordered, flat, faded), and 5 `radius` options (none, sm, md, lg, full).
By default, an icon is shown based on the color. You can provide a custom `icon`, hide it completely (`hideIcon`), or hide just its wrapper (`hideIconWrapper`).
You can add actionable elements, like buttons or links, to an alert by using the `endContent` prop.
You can control the alert's visibility programmatically by using the `isVisible` prop and the `onVisibleChange` event handler.
Key stylable slots for Alert include `base`, `title`, `description`, `closeButton`, and `alertIcon`.
